Global Settings

What do you want to do?

Enable Injection Capture

The monitoring and processing of injection events can be turned off. To do this, set Enable Injection Capture false. The default is false.

Set Initial Voltage Threshold

The FPGA injection monitors both voltage and current for an injector. It compares the voltage channel against the Initial Voltage Threshold to determine the start of an injection event. Set Initial Voltage Threshold to the appropriate level.

Set Injection Duration

Once the initial voltage threshold is found, the voltage and current waveforms are streamed to the controller for analysis. This streaming continues until Injection Duration is reached. Set Injection Duration to the appropriate level. Note: Be sure to add some additional time for varitions in the injection time at different RPMs.

Set Voltage Gain

Use the Voltage Gain setting to apply a gain or scaling to the voltage signal on the FPGA.

Set Current Gain

Use the Current Gain setting to apply a gain or scaling to the current signal on the FPGA.
